page.title: 13Interesting People _ Gorton
page.content: The first person that I interviewed had lived in Gorton for 42 years. He said that he had seen many changes in the area during that time. Many of the old terraced houses had been demolished and the traditional engineering works had been depleted. The locomotive and steel works had gone and many people have been forced to leave. He preferred the area in the past for its friendliness but living conditions were better now. He said that he felt that there was not as strong a sense of responsibility and caring as there used to be especially for the old. He used to work for an engineering firm in West Gorton but was made redundant when it closed. After that he worked in a shop for a year before becoming chief cashier at a bingo and social club. Past events best remembered were the Whit Walks.
